intro: Banara glabrata, commonly known as the smooth banara, is a tropical tree native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often grayish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red or orange berries. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
